class_notes:
"Art in Paris, 1900-1914"This course will focus on avant-garde art in Paris in the years preceding the First World War. Its aim will be to understand the complex dynamics of what we call the avant-garde. This will involve an intensive treatment of certain key problems--important works, moments of decisive change, dominant individuals. At the center of the course will be the achievement of CÃ©zanne and the struggle to lay claim to his art, Matisse's place in the avant-garde world, the Cubism of Picasso and Braque, and a range of practices around the invention of cubist collage.
Art History major/minor: Division III
course_description: Focused survey of modern art in Europe with an emphasis on aesthetic, social, and historical dimensions of modernist practices. Movements include Fauvism, Expressionism, Cubism, Futurism, Dada, Constructivism, and Surrealism. Writings by artists and critics will be considered in relation to the art.
